briefdescription.para: Camera is not working.

detaileddescription.para:
No other information
Use the key "camera_misfunction_interval" in the section "alerts::camera" to set the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Camera is capturing low framerate.

detaileddescription.para:
Information supplied : float framerate;
Use the key "low_framerate_interval" in the section "alerts::camera" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Video decoding has stopped for a given period (10 s by default).

detaileddescription.para:
No other information.
Use the key "video_stalled_interval" in the section "alerts::camera" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: A received media stream suffers from high loss or late rate.

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided is:
loss-rate (float)
late-rate (float)
media-type (string) with values {audio, video, text}
Use the key "loss_rate_interval" in the section "alerts::network" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: A report of high loss rate is received from remote party.

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided: loss-rate (float).
Use the key "remote_loss_rate_interval" in the section "alerts::network" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Packet Burst phenomenon.

simplesect.para: Use the key "burst_occured_interval" in the section "alerts::network" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Loss rate is significant but retransmissions fail to arrive on time.

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided: nack-performance (float) the fraction of lost packets recovered thanks to nack-triggered retransmissions.
Use the key "nack_check_interval" in the section "alerts::network" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Low bandwidth detected.

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided: bandwidth (float) in kbit/s.
Use the key "download_bandwidth_interval" in the section "alerts::video" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Low quality (bitrate) video received.

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided: bitrate (float) in kbit/s, width (integer), int height (integer).
Use the key "low_quality_received_interval" in the section "alerts::video" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: Low quality video is being sent.

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided: bitrate (float)in kbit/s, width (integer), height (integer).
Use the key "quality_sent_interval" in the section "alerts::camera" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: The operating system reports a low radio signal (wifi or mobile)

simplesect.para: Use the key "low_signal_interval" in the section "alerts::network" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: The operating system reports a loss of radio signal (wifi or mobile).

detaileddescription.para:
Information provided: rssi-value (float), signal-type (string) with values {"wifi", "mobile", "other"}.
Use the key "lost_signal_interval" in the section "alerts::network" to set or get the interval at which the problem is checked in a LinphoneConfig.

briefdescription.para: All kinds of alerts.
Callback for notifying about an alert (e.g on Qos)
Callback to know if an alert stops.
Object that represents an alert.

detaileddescription.para: Alerts are raised at run-time when particular conditions are met, for example bad network quality. The full list of available alert types is described by the LinphoneAlertType enum. An application is notified of new alerts through the LinphoneCoreCbs interface. Once raised, the application may use the LinphoneAlertCbs interface to get notified when the alert stops. For each kind of alert, a LinphoneDictionary is filled with relevant informations, returned by linphone_alert_get_informations(). The keys available are documented per-type in LinphoneAlertType enum.

briefdescription.para: Object that represents a callback attached to an alert.
Object to get signal (wifi/4G etc...) informations.
All kinds of alerts.
Set the on alert callback.
Get the on alert callback.
Enable alerts.

detaileddescription.para:
See LinphoneAlert for more details.
core
the LinphoneCore .
enable
whether alert reporting is enabled or not.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether alert reporting is enabled.

detaileddescription.para:
See LinphoneAlert for more details.
core
the LinphoneCore .
whether alert reporting is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Acquire a reference to the alert callbacks object.
Release reference to the alert callbacks object.
Retrieve the user pointer associated with the alert callbacks object.

simplesect.para: The user pointer associated with the alert callbacks object.

briefdescription.para: Assign a user pointer to the alert callbacks object.

parameterdescription.para: The user pointer to associate with the alert callbacks object.

briefdescription.para: Assign a callback for when the alert is terminated.
Get the callback for when the alert is terminated.
Provide a string describing the alert type.
Clone the given alert.

simplesect.para: A new alert with exactly same informations that param.

briefdescription.para: Take a reference on a LinphoneAlert.
Release a LinphoneAlert.
Return the start time of the alert.

simplesect.para: the start time of the alert.

briefdescription.para: Return the end time of the alert.

simplesect.para: the end time of the alert.

briefdescription.para: Return the type of the alert.

simplesect.para: A LinphoneAlertType corresponding to the current alert.

briefdescription.para: Return more informations about the alerts.

simplesect.para: A LinphoneDictionary containing informations about the current alert.

briefdescription.para: Return the call from the alert.
Return the state of the alert.

simplesect.para: true if and only if the alert is active.

briefdescription.para: Add a listener in order to be notified of LinphoneAlert events.

parameterdescription.para: A LinphoneAlertCbs object holding the callbacks you need.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current LinphoneAlertCbs.

detaileddescription.para:
This is meant only to be called from a callback to be able to get the user_data associated with the LinphoneAlertCbs that is calling the callback.
alert
The LinphoneAlert object.
The LinphoneAlertCbs that has called the last callback.

briefdescription.para: Gets the list of listener in the alert.
Removes a LinphoneAlertCbs object associated to the LinphoneAlert.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneAlertCbs object to be removed from the LinphoneAlert.

briefdescription.para: Notify the alert if it is terminated.
Managing Alerts.
